alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 27 at 6:52PM EST until November 29 at 1:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow. Snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches north of Route 6, and lesser amounts across the southern part of the county. * WHERE...Warren County. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes, especially on Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow and most significant impacts will occur after midnight tonight, through Tuesday as the single, intense snow band over Eastern Lake Erie this evening drifts gradually south into the warned area and breaks into several bands. Snowfall rates may reach 1" per hour for brief times within the strongest snow bands. Gusty winds will also lead to blowing and drifting snow with periods of very low visibility of less than one quarter of a mile.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel as significant winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
